document_data.name: Potion of Resistance
document_data.refs2e: <ref group="note">The [[Dungeon Master's Guide 2nd edition|''Dungeon Master's Guide]] of 2nd edition and the ''[[Encyclopedia Magica Volume III]]'' list different prices for the ''potion of fire resistance'', so both prices are provided together as a range. The values for the ''potion of cold resistance'' are sourced from the ''Encyclopedia Magica Volume III'' and the video game [[Baldur's Gate (game)|''Baldur's Gate'']]. The weight is sourced solely from ''Baldur's Gate''.
document_data.mainbody: A '''''potion of resistance''''' was a type of [[potion]] that gave its imbiber resistance to a certain type of damage.
document_data.Description:
The color and smell of the liquid within these potions varied depending upon the type of damage they gave resistance to.

''Potions of fire resistance'' felt chill to the touch and the insides of the bottles were coated with a layer of frost.

''Potions of lightning resistance'' had liquid that was thick and blue, as well as a smell slightly reminiscent of ozone. Some were packaged within ornate bottles shaped to look as though they were made of clouds.{{Cite adventurers league/Breath of the Yellow Rose|28}} When consumed, they caused the imbiber to experience tingling sensation in their extremities.

''Elixirs of necrotic resistance'' were concoctions that smelled of fresh [[herb]]s and berries and had blooming flowed suspended in the vials.

A more powerful variety that granted resistance to all types of magical and mundane damage â€“ ''elixirs of universal resistance'', were a thick concoction that tasted and felt like molten [[iron]]. Once consumed, it made the imbiber palpably feel coated in thick protective feel. Vitriol of [[divine miasma]] was the main component in this potion's creation.
document_data.Powers: Potions of resistance came in ten different forms (fire, cold, acid, lightning, force, thunder, radiant, necrotic, poison and psychic), such as that which granted resistance to [[fire]] was known as a ''potion of fire resistance''. The effect of these potions lasted for an hour.
document_data.Availability:
Places and individuals in the Realms one could purchase ''potions of resistance'' from included the following establishments:
* [[Adventurer Mart]] in [[Athkatla]] sold ''potions of cold resistance''.
* [[Arcana Archives]] in the city of [[Saradush]], and later [[Amkethran]], sold both potions of ''cold'' and ''fire'' resistance.
* [[Holly's Mill]] in the city of [[Ravens Bluff]] sold ''potions of cold resistance''.{{Cite polyhedron/65/The Living City: Holly's Mill|10}}
* [[Min Minling]] sold both potions of ''cold'' and ''fire'' resistance outside the local inn of [[Umar Hills]].
* [[Sorcerous Sundries]] in [[Baldur's Gate]] sold both potions of ''cold'' and ''fire'' resistance.
* The traveling [[deep gnome]] merchant [[Therndle Daglefodd]] sold ''potions of cold resistance''.
document_data.Creation: Some materials known to be used in crafting ''potions of fire resistance'' included asbestos and glacial ice.{{Cite dungeon/182/Eye on the Realms: The Dracohar|67}}
document_data.Notable Owners:
''Potions of poison resistance'' were popular among politicians and adventurers of the Realms.
* [[Hasan ibn al-Din]] - potion of ''fire'' resistance
* [[Zar-Dandan]] - potion of ''fire'' resistance
